intro: Ouratea xerophila, commonly known as the Brazilian wax tree, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and dense, waxy foliage. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a leathery texture with a glossy appearance. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and often have a white or pale pink color.
